intro: Knoxia microphylla, commonly known as the dwarf knoxia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, delicate yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Knoxia microphylla is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
